info.title: Optima CampaignEditor API
info.description: UI handler and the main responsibility carrier of the application, the two step transaction handling owner. The API defines the public interface for the UI and all the user exposed functions are routed here. The actual methods are supports basic segmentation creation and CSV upload functionality. CSV upload is supported via sharepoint. Authentication and JWT token are generated here from Active Directory login. The substraction of public api descriptions are on the API descriptions.

get.summary: Returns basic information about the current user. The profile will be returned.
get.description:
Has only temporary implementation on service since there is no exact functional
requirement for the profile!

get.summary: Returns all the users stored in the system.
Query for groups in the system which were synchronized from the domain Active Directory

parameters.name: permissionId
parameters.description: Permission id

get.summary: Query for all directly referenced users for the given permissionId.

parameters.name: permissionId
parameters.description: Permission id

get.summary: Query for all function permission for the given permissionId.

parameters.name: permissionId
parameters.description: Permission id

post.summary:
Tries to authenticate with the given information against the configured Active
Directory.
post.description:
Gives Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.UnauthorizedResult in case user was not found and in case
any error occurs handles as Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.BadRequestResult.

requestBody.description: The authentication parameters fulfilled model.

post.summary: Returns refresh token for the current user, for long term session.
post.description:
Gives Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.UnauthorizedResult in case user was not found and in case
any error occurs handles as Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.BadRequestResult.

post.summary: Removes the refresh token, effectively logging the user out.

get.summary: Queries for the result information from the database with the given filters and parameters

Download a CSV structured file for a campaign with a given segmentation. Provides 
information which are already processed only.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: The campaign identifier

parameters.name: segmentationId
parameters.description: The corresponding segmentation identifier

post.summary:
Upload the results made for a M:Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.CampaignResultsController.DownloadCsv(System.Int32,System.Int32) request to
a given sharepoint folder. The basic sharepoint configured in the system startup.

requestBody.description: The model determine the path on sharepoint and the CSV to be uploaded

get.summary: Returns the campaigns for the actual query.
get.description:
Their is an implicit parameter which query Optima.CampaignEditor.Application.Common.Enums.CampaignStatus.Set
only for the user who created the draft state, in order to protect it from other users
and let a sandbox campaign designment for the end user.

post.summary:
Used to query the backend for the actual result of a query builder tree/query
Due to known limitations of the GET request, URL max length, used with POST 
to bypass the limitations. As much as GET body request is not well supported,
this violation was introduced.

post.summary: Validates a password change GUID, and if it is expired, sends a new one (email sending is not implemented yet).

requestBody.description: Request object that contains the guid to be validated.

200.description: The password change is valid and usable

400.description: Invalid password change request or Expired password change request

post.summary:
Sets the user's password to the desired new password.
Optionally can be used to change a subset of the user's extension information.
post.description:
User is identified by the Guid in the request.
            
Validation errors:
- The request has to contain at least one property to insert or update.
- Invalid phone number.
- Company too long - if not null and longer than 200.
- Department too long - if not null and longer than 200.
- Position too long - if not null and longer than 200.

requestBody.description: The request which contains data to persist.

post.summary: Initializes a forgot password operation for the given standalone user.
post.description:
- If there is no user for that e-mail, throws.
- If the user is inactive, throws.
- If there is an existing forgotten password request for the user, deletes and recreates it.

requestBody.description: The request object which identifies the user.

post.summary: Resends the password change email to the given standalone user.
post.description:
- If there is no user for that e-mail, throws.
- If the user is inactive, throws.
- If there is an existing password change request for the user, deletes and recreates it.

requestBody.description: The request object which identifies the user.

post.summary: Insert or update extension info for user
post.description:
Validation errors:
- Input data cannot be null or empty if the whole model object is null.
- The request has to contain at least one property to insert or update.
- Invalid phone number.
- Company too long - if not null and longer than 200.
- Department too long - if not null and longer than 200.
- Position too long - if not null and longer than 200.

requestBody.description: It contains company name, department, position, phone number and userid

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Guid identifying the password change.

Bearer.description:
JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. 

 Enter 'Bearer' [space] and then your token in the text input below.

Example: "Bearer 12345abcdef"
Bearer.name: Authorization

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description:
Defines the endpoint which is responsible for the basic authenticated user information
and provide the capability to login. The M:Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.AccountsController.Login(Optima.CampaignEditor.Application.Accounts.Commands.Login.LoginCommand) API
used for the basic authentication and the M:Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.AccountsController.RefreshToken
is for refresh the actual authentication.

tags.name: CampaignResults
tags.description:
Handles result requests which are gets except for sharepoint result upload request.
The result schema is read only for the campaign editor. For further info see architecture.

tags.name: Campaigns
tags.description:
Defines the campaign related operations for the enduser. This API endpoint is 
responsible for all operation which can be made for a campaign creation or 
modification. The basic usage is to create the campaign with 
Optima.CampaignEditor.Application.Common.Enums.CampaignStatus.Set then create the neccesity 
Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.TreatmentsController operations, assign segment, via appropriate
Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.SegmentationsController, update status via the appropriate method e.g.:
M:Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.CampaignsController.Approve(System.Int32), M:Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.CampaignsController.StartNow(System.Int32).

tags.name: Channels
tags.description:
Basic CRUD API to retrive channels. As much as this is a readonly information in the system,
the CRUD CUD parts are missing. Only read can be performed.

tags.name: Emails
tags.description: The basic controller to handle mail send for the EDE.

tags.name: Information
tags.description: Endpoint to get different kinds of information about the API.

tags.name: Languages
tags.description:
API for querying application languages.
here.

tags.name: Localizations
tags.description:
Basic controller to extend the frontend static localization messages with dynamic 
content. The content actually contains only the appropriate language translations.

tags.name: Permissions
tags.description:
CRUD API for permission operations. All the operations of the permissions are routed 
here.

tags.name: Products
tags.description:
CRUD API for product operations. All the operations of the product are routed 
here.

tags.name: SegmentationCategories
tags.description:
CRUD API for segmentation categories operations. All the operations of the segmentation 
categories are routed here.

tags.name: SegmentationQueries
tags.description:
Segmentation query editor, which will target partners proprties to create a group
of entities. The instance is used for configuration retrieve and to run the actual
query against real data.

tags.name: Segmentations
tags.description:
Segmentation CRUD API with extension of file processing endpoints. This extension 
operation was requested for emporary solution since final implementation will be 
shipped.

Final concept: Query editor handling via Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.SegmentationQueriesController
with actual group handling. This controller objective scoped to handle query operation
handler. Deep-, shallow- Copy, campaign connection handling.

Segmentation purpose: handle a group of people like a reference. All segmentation 
carries a list of people with some matching elements each other. A single instance
can be part of multiple segmentations based on their properties.

tags.name: SharePoint
tags.description:
Contains helper for SharePoint CSV upload. This service will provide thw basic 
structure of a SharePoint folder and uploads a selected file. The operation is
used by Optima.CampaignEditor.Controllers.SegmentationsController CSV extension.

tags.name: SiteLevelSettings
tags.description:
CRUD API for site level setting operations. All the operations of the product are routed 
here.

tags.name: StandaloneUsers
tags.description: This controller used for standalone user registration, request password, change password, password reset

tags.name: StaticMergeTags
tags.description: Provides CRUD operations for StaticMergeTag entities.

tags.name: Templates
tags.description: API for template retrive. The basic template CRUD is hidden by enduser.

tags.name: TestGroupCategories
tags.description: CRUD API for product operations. All the operations of the product are routed here

tags.name: Treatments
tags.description: API for treatment retrieve. The basic treatment CRUD is hidden by enduser.

tags.name: UserSettings
tags.description:
CRUD API for usersetting operations. All the operations of the product are routed 
here.

tags.name: ViewModels
tags.description: Contains helpers for the UI to be able to handle campaign creation.
